name: ROK Financial

leaders.bg: Long Island native with two decades in financial services. Co-founded and served as CEO of National Business Capital, where his team secured over $1 billion in financing for nearly 100,000 small businesses over 10 years. Founded ROK Financial in 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic. Appointed co-chairman of the SBFA Broker Council in 2019, a non-profit promoting transparency in alternative lending. Named to The Top 100 Magazine. Speaker at Broker Fair 2025.
hooks: *Built $1B+ lending business at National Business Capital

leaders.bg: Over a decade of experience in alternative finance. Appointed CEO of ROK Financial in December 2022, succeeding James Webster. Previously held executive and sales positions at National Business Capital & Services and Exit Links Real Estate. Has assisted in providing over $1 billion in small business loans. Known for managing sales processes and building teams in the business financing space. President's Club honoree in 2015.

news.h: ROK Financial Named 2025 Inc. 5000 Honoree
news.d: ROK Financial ranked No. 4713 on the 2025 Inc. 5000 list with 63% three-year revenue growth, following its No. 4921 ranking in 2024.

news.h: ROK Financial Expands Alternative Financing Programs for Bad Credit Business Loans
news.d: ROK Financial expanded its suite of programs built for small businesses facing credit challenges, positioning itself at the center of the alternative lending shift nationwide.

news.h: James Webster to Speak at Broker Fair 2025
news.d: ROK Financial founder James Webster was announced as a speaker at the annual Broker Fair conference, reinforcing the company's thought leadership in business finance brokerage.

ice: Congrats on making the Inc. 5000 two years running and expanding your alternative financing programs — as ROK processes 500+ transactions per month, how are you thinking about scaling underwriting speed without adding headcount?

Built the company to $5M in revenue with a lean 7-person team. Led the company to Inc. 5000 recognition in 2025 with 95% three-year growth. Also serves as Director of Operations, overseeing day-to-day workflow.

Co-founded Splash Advance in 2019. Previously served as Vice President of Sales at First Premier Funding, LLC and CEO at Fundshop. Brings deep experience in alternative lending sales and operations. Helped grow Splash Advance from a startup to an Inc. 5000 company in under six years.

leaders.bg: Co-founded Accord Business Funding in 2013 in Houston, TX. Brings nearly five decades of combined commercial funding experience with his co-founder. Established Accord's reputation for speed and flexibility with sub-3-hour decision turnarounds.

Joined Accord Business Funding to lead the company's sales and marketing strategy. name: AdvancePoint Capital

Managing Director of Samson Funding responsible for day-to-day business operations and deal flow. Holds a Bachelor's in Business Economics from SUNY Cortland (2012-2015). name: Breakout Capital Finance

leaders.bg: Over 25 years of experience in finance and banking. 15 years in factoring and small business lending. Previously operated two factoring companies — built and sold one within 18 months. Co-Founder of Charleston Capital Management, an alternative investment asset manager. Co-Founder of inFactor, a technology-powered origination and servicing platform for small business lenders. Promoted from Chief Credit Officer to CEO in January 2020. Clemson University graduate. Deep expertise in asset-based lending, factoring, and capital raising.
hooks: *Built and sold factoring company in 18 months

leaders.bg: Founded Breakout Capital Finance in 2015 in McLean, VA to bring affordable and transparent funding to small businesses. Former investment banker at FBR & Co. and member of the Corporate Strategy Group at Capital One Financial Corporation. Named to the 2016 Trending 40s list of DC's top entrepreneurs under 40. Forbes Finance Council member. Stepped down as CEO in 2019 to focus on AI, machine learning, and blockchain innovation. Through his decade of work as an investment banker in alternative finance, he identified market inefficiencies driving high costs for small business funding.

name: Fundbox

leaders.bg: 25+ years scaling global technology platforms. Former SVP of Advertising and Data at Yahoo, managing 1,300-person engineering/product teams driving Yahoo's $5B/year ad business. Former Senior Director of Product Management at Facebook, overseeing commerce and advertising. name: Funding Circle

leaders.bg: Joined Funding Circle in 2012 and became CEO on January 1, 2022. Previously served as UK Managing Director and Chief Strategy Officer. Led Funding Circle's entry into the US and Continental Europe through acquisition. Part of the core team behind the company's 2018 London Stock Exchange IPO. Former management consultant at the Boston Consulting Group with financial services focus. Worked with NGOs in Tanzania and India. Studied Philosophy, Politics and Economics at the University of Oxford. Named AltFi CEO of the Year 2022 and Fintech Woman of the Year 2021. Innovate Finance PowerList 2017-2023.

leaders.bg: Appointed to the Board as CFO on January 1, 2025. Joined Funding Circle in 2018 as Director of Finance and was part of the team leading the IPO. Previously Group Financial Controller at IG Group Holdings plc. Former Assurance Director at PwC. Transitioned from Director of Finance and Investor Relations to the CFO role.

Co-founded Funding Circle in 2010. Led the company as CEO through its growth to £16B+ in SME loans and London Stock Exchange listing. Received CBE honor. Stepped down from day-to-day operations in 2022, transitioned to Non-Executive Director, then departed the board in October 2024. Retains 4.9% stake. Now focuses on Super Payments, his new venture.
